intro: Jacquemontia pedunculata, commonly known as the purple morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining vines and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant purple to blue flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous seeds. Jacquemontia pedunculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to full sun and well-drained soil.
